definition: to buy frenetically/to snap up (bargains, dwindling supplies etc)
to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch

sentences.english: They are eagerly trying to buy the shoes and boots.
sentences.chinese: 她們都在急切地搶購各種鞋靴。

sentences.english: Rapid inflation and above curtailments acquired by agitation buying.
sentences.chinese: 迅猛的通貨膨脹和搶購造成重大的商品缺乏。

sentences.english: A host of government conglomerates have snapped up coal mining companies in Shanxi Province.
sentences.chinese: 一大批國有企業進入山西搶購煤礦公司。

sentences.english: For fare that the electricity will cut off, people storm into convenience store to grab candles.
sentences.chinese: 爲了勉於斷電之苦，人們踊進便利商店搶購蠟燭。

sentences.english: A rush of salt in the multilateral tide, under the rumours, gradually died down.
sentences.chinese: 一場食鹽的搶購潮，在多方闢謠之下，逐漸平息。

sentences.english: Studio flats meant for artists-in-residence get snapped up by bankers.
sentences.chinese: 藝術家們居住的單間公寓遭到銀行業者的搶購。

sentences.english: Silly city people panic buying salt, afraid that all sea salt from today on will have been exposed to radiation.
sentences.chinese: 小市民瘋狂搶購鹽，恐怕日後的海鹽受到核輻射。

sentences.english: Elsewhere supermarkets reported a surge in panic-buying as shoppers tied to stockpile food supplies.
sentences.chinese: 其他地區的超市裏，羣衆爲了搶購儲存食物一團慌亂。

sentences.english: Just 12 bottles were made and the company has already sold out.
sentences.chinese: 該公司釀製的區區12瓶“歷史終點”已經搶購一空。

sentences.english: But not all salt-buyers were looking for radiation protection.
sentences.chinese: 然而，並非所有的食鹽搶購者都是出於防輻射的目的。

sentences.english: Don't lose more by joining the stampede of buy-high, sell-low market timers.
sentences.chinese: 不要應爲參與高買低賣的搶購風潮而虧損更多。

sentences.english: The rush for rice in Hong Kong began after wholesale prices spiked in Thailand.
sentences.chinese: 泰國的大米批發價格猛漲之後，香港人開始搶購大米。

sentences.english: Food always comes in the mornings - it just gets bought up by people caught up in things.
sentences.chinese: 食品總在早上供應，而且總被搶購的人買走。

sentences.english: This is one of the factors that create unnecessary speculation and also panic buying,” he said.
sentences.chinese: 這些都是造成不必要的市場投機和搶購的因素之一。

sentences.english: Over the National Day holiday in early October, retailers say large flat-screen TVs flew off the shelves.
sentences.chinese: 國慶節當日，零售商說人們搶購大型純平電視。

sentences.english: Rumor spread the prices would go up, many peopel stampeded into a wave of panic buying.
sentences.chinese: 謠傳物價要上漲，很多人捲入了搶購的風潮中。

definition: to rush (to do sth urgent)/to try to be the first/to forestall
to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch
to cut prices/to discount/to mark down/price cutting
to enter the venue/to enter the arena/(aviation) to approach the airfield/(investing) to get into the market
to ratchet up/to raise (expectations etc)/to increase (a quota, a position in the market etc)/to up the ante/(computing) to encode
tempest/wave (of popular sentiment etc)/craze or fad
meeting place/place where people gather/CL:個|个[ge4]
to depart as quick as a flash/flash mob
